title: CockroachDB Overview
description:
## CockroachDB Overview

This dashboard provides a high-level view of your CockroachDB cluster, including:
- A high-level view of SQL performance & latency.
- Information about resource consumption to help aid in capacity planning.
Further reading on CockroachDB monitoring:

- [Monitor CockroachDB with Datadog](https://www.datadoghq.com/blog/monitor-cockroachdb-performance-metrics-with-datadog/)

- [Datadog's CockroachDB docs](https://docs.datadoghq.com/integrations/cockroachdb/).

Clone this template dashboard to make changes and add your own graphs and widgets.

definition.content:
This dashboard provides a high-level view of your CockroachDB cluster, including:
- A high-level view of SQL performance & latency.
- Information about resource consumption to help aid in capacity planning.

#### Optimize your CockroachDB integration configuration for monitoring
1. Configure `cluster`, `node`, and `region` tags in your `cockroachdb.d/conf.yaml` [file](https://github.com/DataDog/integrations-core/blob/7f091cbd40dfa13ec713d00d53caa2273a6cc7f6/cockroachdb/datadog_checks/cockroachdb/data/conf.yaml.example#L583-L591):

    ```
    instances:
      - openmetrics_endpoint: http://localhost:8080/_status/vars
        tags: ["cluster:prod", "node:1", "region:us-east-1"]
      - openmetrics_endpoint: http://localhost:8082/_status/vars
        tags: ["cluster:dev", "node:1", "region:us-east-2"]
    ```
Nodes executed 99% of SQL statements within this time. This time only includes SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE and DELETE statements and does not include network latency between the node and client.
Nodes executed 99% of transactions within this time.This time does not include network latency between the node and client.
Nodes established and authenticated 99% of connections within this time.

To populate these widgets, 1) configure `histogram_buckets_as_distributions: true` in the `cockroachdb.d/conf.yaml` and 2) enable [Advanced Query Functionality](https://docs.datadoghq.com/metrics/distributions/#enabling-advanced-query-functionality): Go to the [Metrics Summary](/metric/summary) page and for each distribution metric, click `Advanced` > `Enable percentiles and threshold queries`.

This graph shows the latency when admitting operations to the work queues within the admission control system. There are lines for requests within the KV layer, write requests within the KV layer, responses between the KV and SQL layer, and responses within the SQL layer when receiving DistSQL responses. This graph shows the rate of latency within the work queues on each node.

Positive admission delay rates may be an indicator that the cluster is having to throttle the current workload in order to remain operational.
